{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3132566,"name":"Franco","username":"0235797","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/0/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-23T21:58:08.951Z","cooked":"

Hi, my team is trying to use a camera with the driver station but when connected it won’t appear, we trid connecting directly to the roborio and the computer but either way it does not show up, we are using java.
Any suggestions or ways we can add a camera to our code?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-01-23T21:58:08.951Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":487,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":2455.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424467,"topic_slug":"camera-not-showing-in-driver-station","display_username":"Franco","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51181,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/camera-not-showing-in-driver-station/424467/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3132571,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-23T22:01:21.020Z","cooked":"

To add a USB camera to the Rio, add CameraServer.startAutomaticCapture(); to your robotInit() function. See Using the CameraServer on the roboRIO — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

I don’t think any current dashboards currently support viewing a camera attached to the driver station computer.

Assuming your code is correct (See @Peter_Johnson response), you have to open SmartDashboard, then on the top right, click View → Add → CameraServer Stream Viewer,

this will create a video stream on the top left by default, and for most people it’s hard to see what is happening because the window is small, you can fix this by clicking View → Editable or CTRL + E, now you can “drag” and “click” on the stream window, this lets you enlarge the video stream.

You can look at the code I wrote for refrence

Robot.java (see robotInit() )

RobotContainer

CamRIO (camera code + AprilTag detection Subsystem class)

Just as a test for your code once you start the camera server you should be able to connect to the Rio over wifi (or Ethernet) and go to 10.##.##.2:1181 fill in the ##.## with your team number for example 20as 10.00.20.2 or 3044 as 10.30.44.2 and port 1181 should bring you to the default camera server if your code is correct and you should see your camera feed along with a table of camera config options and some sliders for zoom, rotation, exposure, etc

You can’t just ‘add a camera’ to driverstation. You have to use networktables and such to display to Shuffleboard or some other sort of networktables app. Personally, I like to output the camera stream to a shuffleboard widget, because there’s already different important datapoints from other things.
